page.title: 04The village shop , Sandridge
page.content: Darby's store is the one remaining foodstore in Sandridge.The main competition is from mobile vans which sell things like fish, fruit, eggs and veg.The store opens at 7.15 am and closes at 5.30 pm.Wednesday is early closing day.The shop closes for lunch. The shopkeeper has one full time and one part time assistant. The land was first owned by the Duke of Marlborough and the shop keeper has the original charter which was signed by the Duke in 1721. Customers come from outside Sandridge as the shop is on the main road.They do not do their large shopping at Darby's but get things that they have forgotten from the supermarket.Darby's prices differ very little from the supermarkets but they offer less choice and have no parking facilities..
